definition: to wind round/to sew with slanting stitches
variant of 繞|绕[rao4], to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour
to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex

sentences.english: All over Taiping there was a festive mood that hung fog-like around the surrounding mountains.
sentences.chinese: 太平的节日气氛似云雾一般缭绕在四周的山间。

sentences.english: She moved away, and only the perfume still lingered where she had stood.
sentences.chinese: 她走了，只有那一股香味还缭绕在她待过的地方。

sentences.english: The smoke-filled cafe became a thing of memory in France.
sentences.chinese: 在法国，烟雾缭绕的酒吧已成往事。

sentences.english: In March, clouds permeating the hollow are typical in the south.
sentences.chinese: 满谷烟云，缭绕着江南的烟花三月。

sentences.english: Annual number of pilgrims and swirling smoke.
sentences.chinese: 常年香客不断，烟云缭绕。

sentences.english: His music will fill the air of my gypsy wagon indeterminately.
sentences.chinese: 乐声飘渺，在我的吉普赛旅行车中缭绕。

sentences.english: The flower opens and failure, the memory of the brand is still in fills the air.
sentences.chinese: 花开了又败，记忆的烙印却依旧在缭绕。

sentences.english: The river is accompanied by evergreen pines, hill ranges and wreathing mist.
sentences.chinese: 河道两岸苍松翠柏，石山绵连，云雾缭绕。

sentences.english: We saw many smokes curling from the valley。
sentences.chinese: 我们看见许多烟雾在山谷中缭绕。

sentences.english: Clouds of smoke and steam filled the air for ever and ever .
sentences.chinese: 空气里长年累月充满着缭绕不绝的浓烟和蒸气。

sentences.english: Yevlenko gave him a wise look through wreathing smoke.
sentences.chinese: 叶甫连柯通过缭绕的烟雾用狡黠的目光瞅了他一眼。

sentences.english: The song hovered, like a whispered benediction, above the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 歌声缭绕在人群上方，如同低声祝福。

sentences.english: Even the permeating fog and shadowing clouds could not veil its splendor.
sentences.chinese: 尽管江雾缭绕，浓云弥漫，也丝毫不能掩藏其璀璨。

sentences.english: Wisps of smoke curled in the air.
sentences.chinese: 一缕缕青烟缭绕在空中。

sentences.english: As the morning mist rises, the Australian rain forest appears never-ending.
sentences.chinese: 晨雾缭绕的时候，澳洲雨林似乎永无止境。

definition: to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
(of a vapor etc) to rise/to hang in the air
to float/to hover/also written 漂浮
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
to dissipate everywhere (of light, sound, gas etc)
